meanings.definition: To surpass in crowing or boasting.
meanings.sent1: The rooster was outcrowing all the other birds in the coop.
meanings.sent2: The proud rooster enjoyed outcrowing his feathered friends every morning.
meanings.sent3: The rooster thought he was outcrowing the sun with his loud crowing.
meanings.sent4: The little bird tried to outcrow the mighty eagle, but to no avail.
meanings.sent5: The rooster's outcrowing could be heard throughout the entire farm.

meanings.definition: To crow louder or more frequently than others.
meanings.sent1: The noisy rooster was outcrowing all the other animals on the farm.
meanings.sent2: The rooster was outcrowing so much that the farmer had to cover his ears.
meanings.sent3: The rooster seemed to be outcrowing the wind with his constant crowing.
meanings.sent4: The rooster's outcrowing echoed through the valley, waking up everyone.
meanings.sent5: The little bird tried to outcrow the big rooster, but it was no match for his loud voice.
